task.title: Adding a server on an Apple device
task.shortdesc: You can change the server connection information, but typically you use the connection information that was set up by your administrator.

context.p: Choose which kind of server you want to add:

step.cmd: From the login panel, choose the Community entry.
In the Communities panel, press Add Community.
Choose either My company's server or HCL Connections Cloud.

context.p: If you select My company's server, you need to set values as specified by your system administrator in the resulting dialog:

step.cmd: For Host Server, enter the server host name.
For Port, enter the server port.
Select Secure Connection on or off.
Enable the Direct connection or Authenticating Proxy option to use a direct socket connection.
Enter your User ID and/or password if you want Connections to remember them.
Enter a name for the community if you want to name the community.
Press Add to add the community.

info.note: Your system administrator may provide a link which fills in some of the above values for you automatically. They may also add Pre-configured communities to your community list.

context.p: If you select HCL Connections Cloud, configuration is more automatic. You must be connected to a network so that the HCL Connections Cloud community can be created.
Specify the correct values for the below options:

step.cmd: Enter your password if you want Connections to remember it.
Press Add to add the community.
step.info: You can create multiple communities using the above procedures. HCL Connections Cloud communities display in the Communities panel along with local server communities. If you have multiple communities, click on the community in the Communities panel that you want to use.
